intro: Fumaria officinalis var. tropidocarpa, commonly known as the tropical yellow weed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a common weed in tropical and subtropical regions.
